quizzes.title: Entertainment Quiz: Line and Sun
quizzes.description: Test your entertainment knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Entertainment, country, line. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: Before Purple Rains director met actress and model Patricia Kotero (Apollonia), this woman was to be Princes girl in the movie.

options.text: Mariah Carey (she was doing backup for Brenda Starr at the time)
Wendy or Lisa (was never determined which would get the part)

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Jennifer Beals (FlashDance)

questions.question: Donny Hathaway and this incredible singer released a number of successful duets including The Closer I Get to You and Where Is the Love.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Roberta Flack

questions.question: Baby, Come to Me was a number one hit for this singer and Patti Austin in 1983.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: James Ingram

questions.question: Which of the following ladies did Prince date in High School?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Susan

questions.question: Name the performer of the 1972 song, containing the following lyrics: You drove your lear jet to Nova Scotia to see a total eclipse of the sun.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Carly Simon

questions.question: Which 1960s American folk rock band sang a song containing the line: We hold but a moment, sunlight fading into gray.?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Youngbloods

questions.question: Princes video Raspberry Beret was a representation of which of these?

options.text: A Preview to his movie Under The Cherry Moon

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Purple Rain scenes with Apollonia

questions.question: The line You can see the sun, but you cant reach it is from a song performed by which of the following?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Howard Jones

questions.question: Which singer became best known for the 1972 hit opening with the line:  Shine on me sunshine, walk with me world?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Donna Fargo

questions.question: Who sang the 1991 song containing the line: The sun was always shining, we just lived for fun?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Queen

questions.question: Name the country singer, who performed a Grammy-winning song containing the following lyrics: Along with the sunshine, theres got to be a little rain sometimes.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Lynn Anderson

questions.question: Sun, sun, sun, here it comes is the refrain of a song recorded by which popular group?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The Beatles

questions.question: Who performed the 1984 hit, which included this line: Empty lake, empty street, the sun goes down alone.?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Don Henley

questions.question: Which singer/songwriter released the 1970 song which contains these lyrics: Ive seen sunny days that I thought would never end?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: James Taylor

questions.question: Whenever I Call You Friend was a successful duet for Kenny Loggins and this singer.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Stevie Nicks

quizzes.title: Entertainment Quiz: Band and Singer
quizzes.description: Test your entertainment knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Entertainment, committee, maryland. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: What band was banned from playing their music in South Africa in 1980 for inciting potential rebellion amongst its young audience?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Pink Floyd

questions.question: Which famous singer was banned from playing at the Ritz ballroom in Bridgeport, Connecticut in 1955?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Fats Domino

questions.question: What American committee was formed in 1985 by the wives of several congressmen with the mission to educate parents about alarming trends in popular music?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: PMRC (Parents Music Resource Center)

questions.question: At a conference sponsored by Crime Prevention Resource Center in Fort Worth, Texas, representatives of several local police departments advocated what form of treatment for Marilyn Manson fans in 1998?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Forced hospitalization

questions.question: I was born in 1979 in Greenbelt Maryland. I am an accomplished singer and have starred in the movies Chicago and Cursed. Who am I?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Mya

questions.question: Steve Hackett was the first guitarist of British rock band Genesis, which was formed in 1967.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: False

questions.question: In 1962, Catholic students in New York were forbidden to dance to what song?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The Twist

questions.question: After Ed Sullivans controversial show in 1957, what famous song performed by Elvis Presley was banned on radio stations across America?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: White Christmas

questions.question: What singer/band was sued by parents in 1987 for the suicide of their son?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Ozzy Osbourne

questions.question: This British saxophonist and flautist joined progressive rock band King Crimson in 1970 and contributed to their second album, In the Wake of Poseidon.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Mel Collins

questions.question: Which one of these songs did not violate FCC rules during 1971?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Rocky Mountain High

questions.question: What singer was banned in the United States from playing his controversial lyrics on the airwaves in 1972?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: John Denver

questions.question: The Shulman brothers, who founded the progressive rock group, Gentle Giant in 1970, were part of which 60s pop group?

options.text: Simon Dupree and the Big Sound

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Simon Dupree and the Big Sound

questions.question: Michael Cretu, David Fairstein and Frank Peterson created this innovative group in 1990. They were among the first to use non-percussion musical instruments and vocal samples like the Gregorian monk chants on their album called MCMXC a.D. Who are they?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Enigma

questions.question: What Rolling Stones song had to be changed so that the band could appear on the Ed Sullivan show?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Lets Spend The Night Together

questions.question: Captured was released by which group?

questions.question: The first album released by British group, King Crimson, was The Cheerful Insanity of Giles, Giles and Fripp.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: False

questions.question: Who was the artist that recorded Alive II?

questions.question: Live After Death was recorded live by which group?

questions.question: Which of the following bands is NOT from Great Britain?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: AC/DC

questions.question: In 1972, this British progressive rock band released their third album, entitled Trilogy.

questions.question: Who recorded Extraterrestrial Live?

questions.question: This group were opening for band Scandal, when they attracted the attention of Derek Shulman, ex-member of Gentle Giant, as a result of which he signed them to PolyGram.

quizzes.title: Science Quiz: Jimmy Buffett and Musicians
quizzes.description: Test your science knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Science, trumpet, trombonist. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: What instrument do all these musicians play: Red Clay, Chet Baker, Art Farmer, Sweets Edison and Cootie Williams?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Trumpet

questions.question: Which one of these performers was not a trombonist?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Joe Venuti

questions.question: While Jimmy Buffett was landing his sea plane in Mexico, the police shot at it, thinking Buffett was a drug smuggler.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: False

questions.question: Where did singer Jimmy Buffett grow up?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Mobile, Alabama

questions.question: Which one  of these performers was not a drummer?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Belvin Jones

questions.question: Jimmy Buffett attended three different colleges before finally earning a Bachelor of Science degree in history and journalism.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: True

questions.question: What was Jimmy Buffetts first album, released in 1970?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Down To Earth

questions.question: This trumpet player, closely associated with jazz, was born on the 4th of July, in Louisiana.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Louis Armstrong

questions.question: Which band featured the Four Brothers?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Woody Herman

questions.question: Jimmy Buffetts fans are known under what name?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Parrot Heads

questions.question: Which one of these musicians did not play the bass?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Django Reinhart

questions.question: Which of these musicians played baritone sax for the Ellington band?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Harry Carney

questions.question: Jimmy Buffett co-wrote two childrens books with his daughter, Savannah Jane. What are their titles?

options.text: The Jolly Man and A Pirate Looks at Fifty
Where is Joe Merchant and Trouble Dolls
The Jolly Man and Trouble Dolls
Tales from Margaritaville and The Jolly Man

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The Jolly Man and Trouble Dolls

questions.question: Jimmy Buffett is known for his work to save which large aquatic animal?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Manatee

questions.question: Singer Jimmy Buffett is also famous as the owner of a chain of stores/restaurants called Margaritaville. Where was the first store opened?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Key West, Florida

quizzes.title: Entertainment Quiz: Song and Love
quizzes.description: Test your entertainment knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Entertainment, musicals, blythe. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: Which of the following musicals was written by Andrew Lloyd Weber?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: All of these

questions.question: Anything You Can Do I Can Do Better is a comic duet from which Broadway/Hollywood musical?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Annie Get Your Gun

questions.question: We Need a Little Christmas is a rousing show stopping number from which Jerry Herman play?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Mame

questions.question: What style of jazz is associated with Miles Davis, Charlie Parker, Dizzy Gillespie, and Thelonius Monk?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Bebop

questions.question: Which Cole Porter show features the song So In Love?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Kiss me Kate

questions.question: The Colors of My Life is a beautiful song performed by the male lead as he contemplates the course of his life in this show.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Barnum

questions.question: Before the Parade Passes By is a song from which Broadway show later made into a movie starring Barbra Streisand?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Hello Dolly

questions.question: Which musician is given credit for developing and popularizing the electric guitar?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Les Paul

questions.question: He was a prodigy on banjo and guitar. He was born to a Roma (Gypsy)  family in Belgium, but grew up outside of Paris. A fire caused partial paralysis of 2 fingers of his left hand, but he continued his career. Who was he?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Django Reinhart

questions.question: Ill Know When My Love Comes Along is a love theme from which musical of the 40’s and 50’s?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Guys and Dolls

questions.question: Which movie musical featured Anne Blythe singing Baubles, Bangles and Beads?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Kismet

questions.question: He a trombonist, famous for his duets with Louis Armstrong and his innovative popsitioning .. Though not a singer, he and  Armstrong often sang on their recordings. Who was he?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Jack  Teagarden

questions.question: In this musical the song I Won’t Send Roses is performed when the male lead is trying to convince his girl that he is not right for her?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Mack and Mabel

questions.question: Which Disney show stages the big production number Be Our Guest?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Beauty and the Beast

questions.question: Why did We Ever Leave Ohio? is a comic lament sung by two sisters as they start their new life in New York in which show?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Wonderful Town

quizzes.title: Entertainment Quiz: Albums and Rap
quizzes.description: Test your entertainment knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Entertainment, john, world. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: You Gots to Chill was a big hit in 1989 for this East Coast rap duo.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: EPMD

questions.question: This hip-hop artist has been an Army soldier, thief, pimp, and successful actor.  One of his biggest hits was for the 1988 film, Colors.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Ice-T

questions.question: This rapper was known for his British accent and eye patch.  The song featured in the sound clip is his popular rap hit Childrens Story.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Slick Rick

questions.question: This rap group was lead by the smooth Shock G and his clownish alter ego, Humpty Hump.  Their most successful album was their 1990 album, Sex Packets.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Digital Underground

questions.question: This rap trio labeled themselves as Plug One, Plug Two and Plug Three. Their album 3 Feet High and Rising was a breakthrough hit in 1989.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: De La Soul

questions.question: This hip-hop group is unique in that they began as a punk band (called The Young Aborigines), and that they are Jewish.  Their albums include Pauls Boutique and Check Your Head.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Beastie Boys

questions.question: Which musical, featuring the songs Youre the Topand I Get a Kick Out of You, was written by Cole Porter?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Anything Goes

questions.question: Who wrote the music for the world famous musical West Side Story that debuted on Broadway in 1957?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Leonard Bernstein

questions.question: While the careers of most hip-hop artists seem to come and go quickly, often not lasting more than a year or two, this rapper has had a successful career spanning over two decades with over 12 albums to his credit.  The song featured in the audio clip is titled Im Bad from his Bigger and Deffer album (1987).
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: LL Cool J

questions.question: This rap group out of Hollis, NYC released several successful albums including Raising Hell (1986) and Tougher than Leather(1988).
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Run D.M.C.

questions.question: Who wrote the music for Girl Crazy which opened at the Alvin Theatre on October 14, 1930?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: George Gershwin

questions.question: This musical, set in Berlin in 1929, was written by Fred Ebb and John Kander.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Cabaret

questions.question: Who wrote the lyrics and music for the Tony Award-winning musical Kiss Me, Kate?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Cole Porter

questions.question: Who wrote the musical La Cage aux Folles which focuses on a gay couple?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Jerry Herman

questions.question: This hip-hop team is generally considered one of the most influential and groundbreaking groups in the history of rap.  Their albums include Paid in Full and Dont Sweat The Technique.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Eric B.  Rakim
